title: The Death of the Plastic Straw | National Geographic
body: "Plastic straws are one of the worst offenders in terms of plastic pollution. By putting in alternatives and eliminating their use across &Beyond's lodges, we are doing our part to keep plastic out of the oceans," says Hempson.

  The article from National Geographic titled "The Death of the Plastic Straw" discusses the increasing trend of hotels, resorts, safaris, and cruises banning plastic straws. It highlights the environmental impact of plastic straws, their contribution to ocean pollution, and the efforts made to reduce their usage across various industries. The text also covers the detrimental effects of plastic pollution on marine life and the initiatives taken by hospitality brands and countries to address this issue. Furthermore, it explores the alternatives to plastic straws and the various materials being used, such as paper, PLA (polylactic acid), bamboo, pasta, and even rye stems. The piece emphasizes the significant role of individual and corporate actions in reducing plastic waste and protecting the environment.
